description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to strengthen urban services and infrastructure in the Nairobi metropolitan region. Thiswill be achieved by (i) investing in local infrastructure (roads, markets, street lighting, bicycle and pedestrian pathways, drainage, and the like), (ii) investing in large-scale metropolitan infrastructure including supporting improvements in integrated solid waste management, sewerage collection and disposal, and transport, and (iii) strengthening the current and future entities responsible for service delivery, including the central ministry, current local authorities and future county governments, utilities and otherservice providers, and possible future metropolitan authorities responsible for planning, transport, and other services.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Transport, Infrastructure, Housing, and Urban Development

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :FA. Article IV.4.01 (a) | Description :The Recipient has prepared and adopted the project's Operations Manual |Due Date :19-Sep-2012

Finance Agreement :FA. Article IV.4.01 (b) | Description :The Recipient has opened and deposited into the Project Counterpart FundsAccount an initial amount equivalent to US$500,000 | Due Date :19-Sep-2012

Finance Agreement :FA. Article IV.4.02 | Description :The Athi Water Services Board Implementation Agreement has been dulyauthorized or ratified by the recipient and AWSB and is legally binding upon the recipient and AWSB in accordance with its terms |Due Date :19-Sep-2012
Finance Agreement :FA. Sche. 2, Section I.A.1(a) | Description :The Recipient has established the project Steering Committee | DueDate :30-Sep-2012

Finance Agreement :FA. Sche. 2, Section I.C.4(d) | Description :Prepare and furnish to the Association, for the Association'sreview, a proposed model of Urban Project Implementation Agreement | Due Date :30-Sep-2012

Finance Agreement :FA. Sche. 2, Section II.B.4 | Description :No later than six months after the Effective Date, the Recipientshall install and configure, in accordance with guidelines satisfactory to the Association, suitable accounting software procuredin accordance with provisions of the Financing Agreement | Due Date :17-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :FA. Sche. 2, Section IV.B | Description :No withdrawal shall be made with respect to category (4) until andafter an AWSB agreement satisfactory to the Association has beenexecuted | Due Date :19-Sep-2012
